meanings.definition: A substance that counteracts poison or disease.
meanings.sent1: She quickly administered the antidotes to the patient who had been poisoned.
meanings.sent2: Doctors keep various antidotes on hand in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The antidotes worked like magic, making the poison disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as an antidote, healing the wounds of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The antidotes were like superheroes, fighting off the evil poison.

meanings.definition: Something that relieves, prevents, or counteracts.
meanings.sent1: Laughter is one of the best antidotes for a bad mood.
meanings.sent2: Music can be a powerful antidote to stress and anxiety.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were the perfect antidotes to a boring day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as an antidote, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: Kind words can be antidotes that heal the heart.
